title: PHV Driver’s Licence - Compliance, Safety, and Customer Service

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger requests to modify the drop-off location mid-journey?
options: Ignore the request and continue the original route
Comply only if the new location is convenient
Assess safety and legality before agreeing to the change
Ask the passenger to book another ride
questions.answer: Assess safety and legality before agreeing to the change

questions.question: Which document must a PHV driver carry while on duty?
options: Birth certificate
Bank statement
Photographic ID badge
College ID card
questions.answer: Photographic ID badge

questions.question: What is the correct action for a PHV driver if their licence is about to expire?
options: Continue driving until notified
Renew it before expiry to avoid suspension
Ignore the expiry until caught
Stop working immediately
questions.answer: Renew it before expiry to avoid suspension

questions.question: What must PHV drivers do when entering a Congestion Charge Zone?
options: Request an exemption from TfL
Avoid it at all costs
Pay the required charge unless exempt
Ignore it if they are only passing through
questions.answer: Pay the required charge unless exempt

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they are involved in a minor accident while on duty?
options: Continue the journey and ignore minor damage
Report it to the operator and authorities if necessary
Only report if a passenger was injured
Fix the issue later without reporting
questions.answer: Report it to the operator and authorities if necessary

questions.question: When is it acceptable for a PHV driver to refuse a passenger?
options: If the passenger is carrying luggage
If the passenger requests a card payment
If the passenger is aggressive or poses a safety risk
If the journey is too short
questions.answer: If the passenger is aggressive or poses a safety risk

questions.question: Which behavior is considered unprofessional for a PHV driver?
options: Making personal comments to passengers
Helping passengers with their luggage
Maintaining vehicle cleanliness
Driving safely and legally
questions.answer: Making personal comments to passengers

questions.question: Which of the following is a legal requirement for PHV drivers?
options: Offering a free ride to disabled passengers
Holding a valid PHV driver’s licence
Carrying cash for change
Wearing a uniform at all times
questions.answer: Holding a valid PHV driver’s licence

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they change their home address?
options: Update it with TfL within 21 days
Only inform their operator
Ignore it unless contacted by TfL
Change it when renewing their licence
questions.answer: Update it with TfL within 21 days

questions.question: Where are PHV drivers prohibited from picking up passengers?
options: At bus stops
Only in rural areas
Anywhere, as long as the passenger agrees
In private parking areas
questions.answer: At bus stops

questions.question: Which action should a PHV driver take if a passenger leaves an item in the vehicle?
options: Sell the item after 24 hours
Return it to the operator or police
Keep it and wait for the passenger to call
Ignore it and continue working
questions.answer: Return it to the operator or police

questions.question: How can a PHV driver ensure passenger safety?
options: Driving safely and following all traffic rules
Locking the doors while driving
Taking the shortest route always
Only allowing cash payments
questions.answer: Driving safely and following all traffic rules

questions.question: Which of the following is prohibited for PHV drivers?
options: Accepting direct street hails
Providing assistance to disabled passengers
Using GPS for navigation
Using a hands-free phone
questions.answer: Accepting direct street hails

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they witness a crime while working?
options: Ignore it and continue driving
Record it and post on social media
Report it to the police as soon as possible
Only report it if they know the suspect
questions.answer: Report it to the police as soon as possible

questions.question: Which insurance is required for PHV vehicles?
options: Comprehensive insurance
Hire or reward insurance
Fire and theft insurance
Personal accident insurance
questions.answer: Hire or reward insurance

questions.question: What must PHV drivers do to comply with safeguarding responsibilities?
options: Discuss passenger details with others
Report concerns to the appropriate authorities
Ignore suspicious behavior
Take photos of passengers for security
questions.answer: Report concerns to the appropriate authorities

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they feel drowsy while driving?
options: Take a break and rest
Drink coffee and continue
Reduce speed but keep driving
Ignore the fatigue and complete the journey
questions.answer: Take a break and rest

questions.question: What is the consequence of driving a PHV without valid insurance?
options: A warning from TfL
Licence suspension and possible prosecution
A small fine
A caution from the operator
questions.answer: Licence suspension and possible prosecution

questions.question: Which of the following must a PHV driver report to TfL?
options: A minor passenger complaint
A criminal conviction
A lost wallet found in the vehicle
A traffic jam causing delays
questions.answer: A criminal conviction

questions.question: How should a PHV driver respond if a passenger refuses to pay?
options: Politely request payment and report to the operator if necessary
Lock the doors and refuse to let the passenger leave
Demand payment aggressively
Take the passenger directly to the police station
questions.answer: Politely request payment and report to the operator if necessary

questions.question: Can you be granted a PHV driver's license while on a student visa?
options: No
Yes, without any restrictions
Yes, you will only be allowed to work for a limited number of hours each week and you will not be allowed to be self-employed
questions.answer: Yes, you will only be allowed to work for a limited number of hours each week and you will not be allowed to be self-employed

questions.question: Do you need to notify TfL about convictions, cautions or arrests?
options: No, the police will inform TfL

Yes, you must tell TfL immediately if you are arrested, charged with, convicted or cautioned for any crime. This includes any fixed notices or road traffic offences that result in penalty points on your driving license.
Yes, but only on your next renewal application
questions.answer: Yes, you must tell TfL immediately if you are arrested, charged with, convicted or cautioned for any crime. This includes any fixed notices or road traffic offences that result in penalty points on your driving license.

questions.question: If you lose your PHV driver’s badge or licence, or somebody steals it, report it immediately to TfL. If your badge has been stolen you should also report it to the police and get a crime reference number from them. Without your badge you cannot continue working as a PHV driver.
options: Without your badge you still can continue working as a PHV driver.
If your badge has been stolen you should also report it to the police and get a crime reference number from them.
TfL will not replace your lost or stolen badge or licence.
questions.answer: If your badge has been stolen you should also report it to the police and get a crime reference number from them.

questions.question: What other changes of personal circumstances must be reported to TfL immediately?
options: You have applied for a PHV driver's license with another licensing authority
You are subject of a sexual offences order
If you have broken the law and have been disqualified from driving
questions.answer: If you have broken the law and have been disqualified from driving

questions.question: Can a license be suspended or revoked with immediate effect?
options: Yes
No
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: It is important that TfL has your correct home address and email address so that you can be contacted with any information about your licence. If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 21 days. You should also tell us about any change to your email address or telephone number.
options: If you change your home address, you should tell TfL immediately
If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 21 days.
If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 48 days.
questions.answer: If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 21 days.

questions.question: What information has the section on London PHV Driver Licensing covered?
options: Information on how to keep passengers safe.
What you need to do to register a private hire vehicle in London.
The rules and policies that a London PHV driver needs to know about
questions.answer: The rules and policies that a London PHV driver needs to know about

questions.question: The licence discs must not be damaged or changed in any way. You should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes. The licence discs contain security features which mean that the discs will be permanently damaged if you try to remove them.
options: You should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes.
You should always remove the discs, when using the vehicle for private purposes.
The discs will not be damaged if you try to remove them.
questions.answer: You should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes.

questions.question: Do you need to carry your insurance certificate with you?
options: You should carry details of the vehicle's valid hire or reward insurance policy whenever you are working.
You should carry details of the vehicle's valid hire or reward insurance policy at all times.
You don't need to carry any proof of your vehicle insurance.
questions.answer: You should carry details of the vehicle's valid hire or reward insurance policy whenever you are working.

questions.question: What is a PHV licence disc?
options: Proof that your vehicle has a valid PHV licence.
Special sticker that allows you to park on red routes.
Congestion charge exemption sticker.
questions.answer: Proof that your vehicle has a valid PHV licence.

questions.question: What happens if you try to remove a licence disc?
options: It will peel off easily.
It will get permanently damaged.
It will damage your windscreen.
questions.answer: It will get permanently damaged.

questions.question: Can you remove the licence discs when you're going for holiday?
options: No, you should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes.
Yes, you can remove the discs if you are using the vehicle for private purposes but you must remember to put them back.
Yes, but only the front disc.
questions.answer: No, you should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes.

questions.question: When can a replacement vehicle licence disc be issued?
options: When the original discs are lost or stolen.
When you take the original discs off for holiday.
When the original discs are damaged.
questions.answer: When the original discs are lost or stolen.

questions.question: Please remember, you cannot use a vehicle for private hire purposes if the licence discs are missing, have been badly damaged or their appearance has been spoilt in any way.
options: You can use a vehicle for private hire purposes if the licence discs are missing.
You cannot use a vehicle for private hire purposes if the licence discs are missing.
You do not have to display the disc.
questions.answer: You cannot use a vehicle for private hire purposes if the licence discs are missing.

questions.question: So that the booking is valid - your passenger at a late night venue must book the journey with?
options: The bartender.
Licensed London operator.
Security guard outside the venue.
questions.answer: Licensed London operator.

questions.question: Not to behave in an anti-social manner means?
options: Not to leave litter in the street or road, not to go to the toilet in a public place.
Not to leave your engine running.
To accept bookings from strangers on the street.
questions.answer: Not to leave litter in the street or road, not to go to the toilet in a public place.

questions.question: Where are licence discs fixed?
options: To the front and rear windscreens of the vehicle.
To the front windscreen of the vehicle.
To the rear windscreen of the vehicle.
questions.answer: To the front and rear windscreens of the vehicle.

questions.question: As a London PHV driver, you can only carry out bookings that you have received from a licensed London PHV operator. You must carry out these bookings in a London licensed PHV that has PHV licence discs on display (unless exempt).
options: You must carry out these bookings in a London licensed Toyota Prius.
You must carry out these bookings in a London licensed PHV that has PHV licence discs.
You must carry out these bookings in MPV cars.
questions.answer: You must carry out these bookings in a London licensed PHV that has PHV licence discs.

questions.question: You are not sure if the operator you're looking to work for is licensed. What should you do?
options: Trust them without checking.
Only ask them for their licence number.
Ask them for their licence number and check it using TfL's online licence checker tool.
questions.answer: Ask them for their licence number and check it using TfL's online licence checker tool.

questions.question: Where do you need to park to wait for a booking from Heathrow Airport?
options: At McDonald's.
At any local petrol station.
Only in an official car park or the PHV Authorised Vehicle Area.
questions.answer: Only in an official car park or the PHV Authorised Vehicle Area.

questions.question: When your passenger is disabled or travelling with assistance dogs you:
options: Can refuse to carry out the booking if you don't like dogs.
Must not refuse to take them.
Can refuse to carry out the booking - only licensed taxis are required to carry disabled passengers.
questions.answer: Must not refuse to take them.

questions.question: Where you should not wait for passengers?
options: In local car parks or residential streets.
At taxi ranks.
At official car parks.
questions.answer: At taxi ranks.

questions.question: You cannot enter Heathrow Airport to pick up passengers:
options: On Christmas Day.
Unless you have a booking from your operator.
On Sundays.
questions.answer: Unless you have a booking from your operator.

questions.question: TfL’s website has a licence checker tool which contains the details of all licensed private hire drivers, vehicles and operators. This is a public register which you and anyone else can use.
options: TfL’s website has no licence checker.
There is a feature on TfL's website called a licensing checker that provides a list of all licensed private hire companies, drivers, and vehicles.
Licensing checker is only for TfL Officials.
questions.answer: There is a feature on TfL's website called a licensing checker that provides a list of all licensed private hire companies, drivers, and vehicles.

questions.question: Can you update a fare if the passengers change the destination?
options: Yes, but only within Greater London.
No, you must inform your operator and they will be able to do it.
Yes, within and outside Greater London.
questions.answer: No, you must inform your operator and they will be able to do it.

questions.question: Airports are private property - are they allowed to make their own rules (byelaws) about taxis and PHVs?
options: Yes, but only about taxis.
Yes, about both taxis and PHVs.
No, they are not allowed to make any own rules.
questions.answer: Yes, about both taxis and PHVs.

questions.question: What may affect the environment and people living around the operating centre?
options: Noise.
You reading a book in your vehicle while waiting for a booking.
Traffic & customer movement.
questions.answer: Noise.

questions.question: You as a driver are responsible for:
options: For the members of the public around your vehicle.
For parking your vehicle & the noise it makes.
For your own behaviour.
questions.answer: For your own behaviour.

questions.question: What should you do if a passenger disagrees with the fare or is unable to pay at the end of the journey?
options: You should check with your operator what to do.
You should call and wait for the police without informing your operator.
You should allow the passenger to walk away without paying.
questions.answer: You should check with your operator what to do.

questions.question: You are not allowed to pick people up on the street or at stations or airports unless they have booked you through a licensed operator. This includes the street outside your operator’s centre.
options: You can pick a passenger up on the street or at stations or airports without a booking.
If a passenger has not booked you through a London licensed operator, you aren't allowed to pick them up off the street, at a station, or at an airport.
You can pick a passenger up without a booking only at the airport.
questions.answer: If a passenger has not booked you through a London licensed operator, you aren't allowed to pick them up off the street, at a station, or at an airport.
